story.title: A long time ago in a far far 2019...
story.description: My journey into frontend development began in 2019. While studying at university, I became interested in web development. Initially, I set myself a simple goal to create a basic website about my favorite Lo-Fi music. But at some point, I discovered React and wanted to make a full-fledged SPA, and that's when it all started

Evraz.stack: TypeScript, React, Redux Toolkit, Effector, Apollo + GraphQL, WebSocket, Vite, Webpack, Storybook, Yup, Echarts
Evraz.projects: Worked in a team of 41+ people on production digitalization projects. Development followed Scrum and Github Flow, tasks were managed in Microsoft Azure.
Evraz.achievements:
Developed a QR-code issuance service from scratch for employee access to special production zones.

Created an MVP with analysts for managing blast furnace reports. Implemented a Node.js mock server and Excel report export.

Developed 27+ components for internal UI-Kit: from "smart" buttons to dynamic tables. This allowed us to move away from Ant Design and speed up development.

Refactored a large legacy project to use hooks, typescript and Feature Sliced Design.

In a dashboard with 12,000+ users, replaced polling with WebSocket. As a result - significantly reduced server load and eliminated 500 errors.

Participated in Power BI and SAP replacement: developed charts using Echarts, Apexcharts, Highcharts, Charts.js and D3.js for custom requirements.

OneTwoTrip.stack: React, TypeScript, React Query, Webpack, React Virtualized, Styled Components, NextJs, Jest, i18next
OneTwoTrip.projects:
Worked on the hotel search and recommendations part of the project at OneTwoTrip.

Domain area — development and improvement of UI for online travel booking platform.

500,000+ users/month, working in a team of 20+ people using Kanban.
OneTwoTrip.achievements:
Increased TypeScript coverage in the codebase, which simplified feature development and helped avoid numerous errors.

Implemented CSS tokens concept together with designers, which facilitated color palette updates and inter-team collaboration.

Worked with bank partner on implementing and supporting 3DS 2.0 protocols for payment processing.

Ensured successful PCI DSS audit completion, applying knowledge from OWASP Top 10. Developed Backend for Frontend on Node.js for aggregating data from different endpoints and packaging them into a single request.

TwoGis.stack: JavaScript, React, Redux, Redux-Thunk, Webpack, Jest, React Hook Form
TwoGis.projects: Worked in a team of 5 people on the Otello project — an online hotel and accommodation booking platform, participating in frontend service development.
TwoGis.achievements:
Created interface components using React following internal design system, made improvements to the project's common UI-Kit for development convenience.

Integrated REST API with backend, connecting third-party services to the project for proper functionality.

Collaborated with designers and analysts, adding animations and interactive elements that made the platform more user-friendly.

skills.experienceDescription:
This describes my commercial experience, excluding pet projects and freelance work. Of course, this is just a brief summary, not everything is covered here.

After graduating from university, I started looking for work in my city, and 2GIS became my first company. There I mastered React and basic principles of clean code, as well as learned about main processes.

After a year, I moved to Saint Petersburg and opened my resume again. OneTwoTrip became my second company, where I learned about security basics as I joined a team working with user card data and similar sensitive information.
